studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Mandatory treatment discontinuation requirement for subjects developing retinal vasculitis (RV) and/or retinal vascular occlusion (RO).
Added guidance for COVID-19 vaccination and vitrectomy timing.
Instruction to withhold IVT injection if any sign of intraocular inflammation (IOI) is present.
Standardization of pregnancy testing across both study arms.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Implementation of Urgent Safety Measures (USM) following identification of causal immune-mediated mechanism for RV and RO.
Address gender imbalance observations in IOI following brolucizumab treatment.
Modifications due to the COVID-19 pandemic and post-marketing safety reports of RV/RO in nAMD patients.

studyChanges.afterText: Requirement of treatment discontinuation was added if subject developed RV and/or RO.
studyChanges.summary: Mandated treatment cessation for specific retinal safety events.

studyChanges.afterText: Recommendations on the time window for a study subject to receive the COVID-19 vaccine or vitrectomy.
studyChanges.summary: Added concomitant therapy guidance for vaccines and surgery.

studyChanges.afterText: Window definition of the Baseline/Day 1 visit window and timing of EOS visit for early study discontinuation.
If any sign of intraocular inflammation is present, an IVT injection must not be performed.
studyChanges.summary: Safety-driven modification to injection administration rules.
